item.value: assume that line-heights greater than 10 are meant to be absolute in 'px'
The font size to use to work out the line height - defaults to $global-font-size
Value to convert to a unitless line height
working out
Converts a pixel, percentage, rem or em value to a unitless value based on a given font size. Ideal for working out unitless line heights.
Turn 0rem into 0
Calculate rem if units for $value is not rem or em
Transform em into rem if someone hands over 'em's
Return a string containing the value as its Sass representation.
A number in rems, calculated based on the given value and the base pixel value. rem values are passed through as is.
Base for pixel conversion.
Pixel value to convert.
By default, the base pixel value used to calculate the rem value is taken from the `$global-font-size` variable.
*Any* value passed, regardless of unit, is assumed to be a pixel value.
regardless of unit
*Any* value passed,
*Any* value passed, regardless of unit, is assumed to be a pixel value. By default, the base pixel value used to calculate the rem value is taken from the `$global-font-size` variable.
Converts a unitless, pixel, or rem value to em, for use in breakpoints.
Using rem as base allows correct scaling
This is because 100% font size = 16px in most all browsers
If the base font size is a %, then multiply it by 16px

The base value to use when calculating the `rem`. If you're using Foundation out of the box, this is 16px. If this parameter is `null`, the function will reference the `$global-font-size` variable as the base.
One or more values to convert. Be sure to separate them with spaces and not commas. If you need to convert a comma-separated list, wrap the list in parentheses.
Converts one or more pixel values into matching rem values.
The same number, sans unit.
Removes the unit (e.g. px, em, rem) from a value, returning the number only.
Rounds a number down to the previous whole number.
Handles decimal exponents by trying to convert them into a fraction and then use a nth-root-algorithm for parts of the calculation
A percentage value for the height relative to the width of a responsive container.
Ratio to use to calculate the height, formatted as `x by y`.
Calculates the height as a percentage of the width for a given ratio.
The product of the exponentiation.
Finds the greatest common divisor of two integers.

Changes the appearance of buttons and other controls to resemble native controls.
This shorthand property specifies how an inline-level box is aligned within the line. Values are the same as for its longhand properties, see below.

Add the correct display in Edge, IE 10+, and Firefox.
Change font properties to `inherit` in Safari.
Correct the inability to style clickable types in iOS and Safari.
Remove the inner padding in Chrome and Safari on macOS.
Correct the outline style in Safari.
